```/opt/bin/x86_64-apple-darwin14-libgfortran3-cxx03/install_name_tool -id LLVMEnzyme-9.dylib lib/LLVMEnzyme-9.dylib```

I've asked about this before, but it has gotten lost to slack history limit.
I'm still having some trouble getting a local run of the `GDAL` Yggdrasil script to work.

I am now working on `1.6.0-DEV` (compiled from the `release-1.6` branch)

`Version 1.6.0-DEV.1780 (2020-12-19)`
`release-1.6/de69b02a48 (fork: 58 commits, 19 days)`

and I am using the `master` branches of `BinaryBuilder` and `BinaryBuilderBase`

`[12aac903] BinaryBuilder v0.3.0 <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/BinaryBuilder.jl.git#master>`
`[7f725544] BinaryBuilderBase v0.5.0 <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/BinaryBuilderBase.jl.git#master>`

running `julia build_tarballs.jl --verbose --debug` fails resolving dependency versions like:

```[ Info: Copying content of bundled in srcdir...
   Resolving package versions...
ERROR: LoadError: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package LibSSH2_jll [29816b5a]:
 LibSSH2_jll [29816b5a] log:
 ├─possible versions are: 1.9.1 or uninstalled
 └─restricted to versions 1.9.0 by an explicit requirement — no versions left
Stacktrace:
  [1] check_constraints(graph::Pkg.Resolve.Graph)```
I have also tried on a nightly build with the same results.

`Version 1.7.0-DEV.45 (2020-12-13)`
`Commit 8f2b0e7176 (15 days old master)`

It passes CI and builds in the <https://dev.azure.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/_build/results?buildId=8050&view=logs&j=602baf21-6ef1-59f6-fbf0-2d9fa93f2756&t=01a2bb1e-9661-5612-34b4-6bc9235fd7d7|Azure pipeline> . Are there any other differences in the CI environment that I would need to make to get it working locally?

I am seeing this on Yggdrasil when rebuilding libjulia_jll 1.5.3 (no actual changes, just rebuilding it):
```[12:01:23]  ---> apk add coreutils libuv-dev utf8proc
[12:01:23] ERROR: unsatisfiable constraints:
[12:01:23]   ninja (virtual):
[12:01:23]     provided by: samurai
[12:01:23]     required by: world[ninja]
[12:01:23]  ---> apk add coreutils libuv-dev utf8proc
[12:01:23] Previous command exited with 1
[12:01:23] Child Process exited, exit code 1```
Huh?

Julia CI tests for buildbot/package_win32 and buildbot/package_win64 are failing with error: `
```C:/buildbot/worker/package_win32/build/usr/tools/llvm-size.exe: error while loading shared libraries: LLVM.dll: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory```

messages.text:
<@U66GD0880> <@UDB26738Q>  So... there seem to be issues in building this...
<https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C674ELDNX/p1609619097249600>

I propose a Qt6_jll
1. This will be an experiment where I just test how Qt6_jll builds with the build_tarballs.jl of Qt_jll
2. <@U6V6FEY1L> is working on a Qt6 version of QML.jl. Whenever he decides to release it, we can delete Qt6_jll and copy its build_tarballs.jl to that of Qt_jll
3. qttools 6.0.0 has cmake support, unlike 5.15.2. It should become easier to build a binary out of that. For that we require qt6 binaries.

messages.text: If someone wants a job doing this stuff contact me: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/devops-and-mlops-with-the-mit-julia-lab/52795>

attachments.title: Devops and MLops with the MIT Julia Lab
attachments.text: We’re looking for a new devops and MLops engineer to work with the Julia Lab. You’d be in charge of keeping all of our systems running and creating new schemes to accelerate Julia development. Julia’s Base CI, the FluxML, SciML and GPU resources are managed by this position. Automated benchmarking tools, automating the installation of Julia in R and Python packages, helping improve Julia’s setup for compute clusters, building tools to make it easy to manage ML training in Git repositories, etc. ...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Devops and MLops with the MIT Julia Lab

messages.text:
I'm trying to build a <https://github.com/jstrube/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper|new package> and deploy some Windows jlls. `--deploy=local` works fine, but trying to deploy to my github repo fails with the following error. Somehow, the wrong thing is being passed to LibGit2, but I failed to google the error.
```julia Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper/.ci/build_tarballs.jl x86_64-w64-mingw32-cxx11,x86_64-linux-gnu-cxx11 --deploy=jstrube/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper_jll.jl --verbose
[ Info: Building and deploying version 0.1.1+0 to jstrube/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper_jll.jl
ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching LibGit2.GitHash(::Nothing)
Closest candidates are:
  LibGit2.GitHash() at /home/jstrube/Applications/julia-stable/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LibGit2/src/types.jl:23
  LibGit2.GitHash(::NTuple{20,UInt8}) at /home/jstrube/Applications/julia-stable/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LibGit2/src/types.jl:21
  LibGit2.GitHash(::LibGit2.GitHash) at /home/jstrube/Applications/julia-stable/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LibGit2/src/types.jl:24
  ...
Stacktrace:
 [1] init_jll_package(::String, ::String, ::SubString{String}; gh_auth::GitHub.OAuth2, gh_username::String) at /home/jstrube/.julia/packages/BinaryBuilder/OMMHj/src/AutoBuild.jl:895
 [2] init_jll_package(::String, ::String, ::SubString{String}) at /home/jstrube/.julia/packages/BinaryBuilder/OMMHj/src/AutoBuild.jl:860
 [3] build_tarballs(::Any, ::Any, ::Any, ::Any, ::Any, ::Any, ::Any, ::Any; kwargs::Any) at /home/jstrube/.julia/packages/BinaryBuilder/OMMHj/src/AutoBuild.jl:211
 [4] top-level scope at /media/jstrube/24988e98-7094-4b00-aeb9-5c98c5b52a901/Data/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper/.ci/build_tarballs.jl:41
 [5] include(::Function, ::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:380
 [6] include(::Module, ::String) at ./Base.jl:368
 [7] exec_options(::Base.JLOptions) at ./client.jl:296
 [8] _start() at ./client.jl:506
in expression starting at /media/jstrube/24988e98-7094-4b00-aeb9-5c98c5b52a901/Data/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper/.ci/build_tarballs.jl:41```
The build script I'm running is this: <https://github.com/jstrube/Minuit2_Julia_Wrapper/blob/main/.ci/build_tarballs.jl>

messages.text:
they renamed the package :picard_facepalm:

* <https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/package/v3.9/main/x86_64/ninja>
* <https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/package/v3.12/main/x86_64/samurai>

but it was called `ninja` when the rootfs was created: <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/blob/b1e419eeb83e8323f3a045e37b927b575dec9cf4/0_RootFS/Rootfs/build_tarballs.jl#L137>
